statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Anthony Gurley scored 21 points Friday, helping Massachusetts break a four-game losing streak in a 71-54 victory over Boston University.
article.headline: BU loses to UMass for 11th consecutive time
article.linkText: BU loses to UMass for 11th consecutive time
article.story: AMHERST, Mass. -- Anthony Gurley scored 21 points Friday, helping Massachusetts break a four-game losing streak in a 71-54 victory over Boston University. Gurley, a senior guard, surpassed the 1,000-point milestone for his career with the Minutemen. He also played briefly at Wake Forest, where he scored 199 points. He has a total of 1,217. John Holland added 17 points, and Darryl Partin and D.J. Irving each contributed 12 points for the Minutemen (8-4), who beat Boston University for the 11th consecutive time. The Terriers (5-9) missed their first 10 shots while Massachusetts took a 15-2 lead. But they passed the Minutemen, at 23-21 and 25-23, before settling on a 25-25 tie at halftime. Massachusetts broke the game open with a 13-0 run that turned a 49-47 lead into a 62-47 advantage with 5:27 left. The Terriers went 5:38 without a point, eventually falling behind by 19 points.
